metadata.title: CVE-2018-16081 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Allowing the chrome.debugger API to run on file:// URLs in DevTools inGoogle Chrome prior to 69.0.3497.81 allowed an attacker who convinced auser to install a malicious extension to access files on the local filesystem without file access permission via a crafted Chrome Extension.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16081` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
